metadata.titel_preek: The Baptism of Our Lord: Epiphany and the Transfer of Dominion

kernfrasen: victory over the powers of darkness
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: SALVATION IS A TRANSFER OF TERRITORIAL DOMINION

kernfrasen: act of righteousness leads to acquittal
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: MORALITY IS LAW AND SALVATION IS ACQUITTAL

kernfrasen: axe is laid to the root
winnowing fork is in his hand

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: He has delivered us from the dominion of darkness and transferred us to the kingdom of his beloved Son.

cognitieve_implicaties: The believer is no longer under the 'laws' or 'power' of the old regime.
theologische_implicaties: Christus Victor atonement; salvation is an objective change in status, not just a subjective feeling.
ethische_implicaties: Allegiance must be total; one cannot serve two masters.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Dualistic worldview that may demonize the 'outside' world.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes this by using the image of the Cologne carving (demon under feet) to make the 'dominion' concrete.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully links the Juridical (Judgment) and Military (Dominion) domains through the person of Christ who 'takes the judgment upon himself' while simultaneously 'conquering the demons.'

incoherentie_punten.metafoor_b: JUDGE AS CHAFF (Self-identification with the rejected)
incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The preacher notes that Jesus 'relinquishes his power as the reaper and will make common cause with the chaff.'
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: The reaper's job is to destroy the chaff; if the reaper becomes the chaff, the agrarian logic of harvest fails.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Theological Paradox: The one who judges is the one who is slain.

sterktes.beschrijving: Uses the visual art of Saint Maria im Kapitol to turn a dead 'dominion' metaphor into a living, visceral image.
sterktes.voorbeeld: A demon prostrate in the water under his feet.

risicos.beschrijving: The military language of 'victory over powers' can lead to a triumphalist view of the church.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregants may view faith as a power-struggle rather than a path of service.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The River Jordan as a 'large and very crowded stage' of cosmic drama.

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; creates a sense of 'being there'.

verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: Baptism as a cosmic defection/transfer of power.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligned with the Epiphany/Theophany tradition.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by 'Power' and 'Judgment' metaphors. It moves from the concrete water of Jordan to the abstract 'waters of death' and 'fire of judgment.' The landscape is one of high stakes, cosmic conflict, and legal rectification.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Connect the 'water' more to the 'immersion' as a 'descent into hell' to keep it from being merely hygienic.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The water isn't just cleaning skin; it is drowning the old regime.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explain that Christ 'reaps' the sin by becoming the 'chaff' that is burned, thus satisfying the agrarian logic through substitution.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Suggests a territorial or political boundary.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Clarify that this 'kingdom' operates by 'truth and grace' (Watts) rather than worldly force.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To explain 'fulfilling all righteousness' as completing a structure or foundation.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful use of CMT to elevate a sacramental act from a social custom to a cosmic event. The use of visual art to anchor metaphors is a homiletical best practice.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: An aesthetic analysis would praise the 'tableau' imagery; CMT shows that this tableau functions as a cognitive map for understanding the 'change of dominion'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's focus on learning styles, CMT reveals how the preacher uses the 'Military' schema to overwrite the 'Domestic' schema of infant baptism.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher's difficulty with 'fulfilling all righteousness' stems from the polysemy of the JURIDICAL source domain (Justice vs. Righteousness).

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Container' schema (In Christ, into death, out of water, into the kingdom).
